thread.title: Meet the 2023-24 Herald-News Girls Wrestling All-Area Team
thread.title_full: Meet the 2023-24 Herald-News Girls Wrestling All-Area Team

author: Rob Oesterle
title: Meet the 2023-24 Herald-News Girls Wrestling All-Area Team
text: Here is the 2023-24 Herald-News All-Area Girls Wrestling Team. FIRST TEAM Addison Calteaux, Minooka: Calteaux, a sophomore, finished fourth at 130 at the state finals for the [Indians](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/minooka-preps/). She ended the season with a 27-6 record. Kiernan Farmer, Peotone: Farmer, a senior, won the state championship at 170 for the [Blue Devils](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/peotone-preps/). She finished the season with a record of 21-1. Gracie Guarino, Lincoln-Way Central: Guarino, a senior, took third at 115 for the [Knights](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/lincoln-way-central-preps/). She is a three-time state medalist after taking second at 120 the previous two seasons. She ended her season with a record of 27-1. Claudia Heeney, Lockport: Heeney, a sophomore, won the 130-pound state championship for the [Porters](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/lockport-preps/) with a 4-2 decision over Collinsville’s Taylor Dawson. She finished her season with a 21-1 record despite missing five weeks because of a broken thumb. Eliana Paramo, Joliet Township: Paramo, a senior, won her third state medal for the [Steelmen](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/joliet-central-preps/), finishing second at 110 to Lockport’s Morgan Turner. She finished her season with a recored of 37-4. Katie Ramirez-Quintero, Bolingbrook: Ramirez-Quintero, a senior, won her second state medal by taking third at 135 for the [Raiders](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/bolingbrook-preps/). She ended her season with a record of 34-4. Alicia Tucker, Plainfield Central: Tucker, a junior, finished second at 170 after winning the state title at 155 last season for the [Wildcats](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/plainfield-central-preps/). She finished her season with a record of 36-2 with both losses coming to state champion Kiernan Farmer of Peotone. Morgan Turner, Lockport: Turner, a sophomore, won the 110-pound state championship after becoming the first girl to win a medal at the state boys tournament last year while attending Bremen. Turner spent most of the season wrestling for the Porters’ boys team and finished with a record of 11-0 in girls matches. HONORABLE MENTION Teagan Aurich, [Plainfield South](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/plainfield-south-preps/); Eva Beck, Minooka; Izabel Barrera, Joliet Township: Cheya Bishop, [Joliet Catholic Academy](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/joliet-catholic-preps/); Averi Colella, Lockport; Morgan Congo, [Morris](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/morris-preps/); Zoe Dempsey, [Lincoln-Way West](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/lincoln-way-west-preps/); Sammie Griesen, [Seneca](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/seneca-preps/); Peyton Kueltzo, Minooka; Grace Laird, Joliet Catholic Academy; Ella McDonnell, Morris; Rebekah Ramirez, Lockport; Henessis Villagrama, [Romeoville](https://www.shawlocal.com/tags/romeoville-preps/).
